title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct explanation equivalent to the following.

· The time periods Δ  t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D85@ and Δ  t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D86@ correspond to the melting and vaporization of VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ , respectively. The data imply that the enthalpy of vaporization of VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ is greater than its enthalpy of fusion. As a result, it requires more energy, and correspondingly a longer period of time, for VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ to completely vaporize than to completely melt.

The response provides a correct explanation equivalent to the following.

· The time periods Δ  t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D85@ and Δ  t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D86@ correspond to the melting and vaporization of VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ , respectively. The data imply that the enthalpy of vaporization of VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ is greater than its enthalpy of fusion. As a result, it requires more energy, and correspondingly a longer period of time, for VbO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C73@ to completely vaporize than to completely melt.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Greater than. When the volume of the system decreases, Q<K MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaWGrbGaeyipaWJaam4saaaa@3BA5@ and the distribution of species shifts towards the product.

OR

· Greater than. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, decreasing the volume of a gaseous equilibrium system will shift the distribution of species towards the side with the fewest number of gas particles. In this case, the shift favors the product.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Greater than. OR

· Greater than. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, decreasing the volume of a gaseous equilibrium system will shift the distribution of species towards the side with the fewest number of gas particles. In this case, the shift favors the product.
